description: An example app built using Next.js 13 server components.
mission: I'm building a web app with Next.js 13 and open sourcing everything. Follow along as we figure this out together.
source_code_available: The source code is available on
about_this_project: This project is an experiment to see how a modern app, with features like auth, subscriptions, API routes, and static pages would work in Next.js 13 app dir.
ui_components: UI components built using Radix UI and styled with Tailwind CSS.
subscriptions: Free and paid subscriptions using Stripe.
also_features_blog: Taxonomy also includes a blog and a full-featured documentation site built using Contentlayer and MDX.
is_open_source: Taxonomy is open source and powered by open source software.
next_13: App dir, Routing, Layouts, Loading UI and API routes.
react_18: Server and Client Components. Use hook.
database: ORM using Prisma and deployed on PlanetScale.
